title: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang abused by Arsenal fans after Granit Xhaka meltdown during Crystal Palace draw
text:
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang has enjoyed a fine start to the season despite Arsenal’s struggles (Picture: Getty)

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang was abused by some Arsenal fans as he left the Emirates following the disappointing draw with Crystal Palace on Sunday.

Unai Emery’s side squandered a two-goal lead at home to London rivals Palace in a match which saw Arsenal captain Granit Xhaka clash with his own fans.

Defensive duo Sokratis Papastathopoulos and David Luiz both scored early goals to put the Gunners in control but Palace hit back through Luka Milivojevic and Jordan Ayew.

Aubameyang was abused by some Arsenal fans (Picture: Twitter)

Arsenal have now won just one of their last four Premier League fixtures, dropping four points below fourth-placed Chelsea in the table.

Xhaka was not the only player to be receive criticism from Arsenal fans over the weekend, with Aubameyang abused by some supporters as he left the ground in his car.

A video posted on social media shows Aubameyang receiving abuse as he drove away from the Emirates.

I’m actually speechless Preciana brown shouting abuse at @Aubameyang7 after the game on Sunday; “£2000 a year to watch shit? Fuck off”. Weird she’s shouting it at the player that’s bailed us out on numerous occasions Then it puts them off stopping for legit fans pic.twitter.com/VFDnjmL42Z — saxon71 (@stuafc71) October 29, 2019

‘£2,000 a year to watch s**t… f**k off!’ a frustrated fan is heard saying twice in his direction.

Another says: ‘These people pay £1,800 for a season ticket… they are your support!’

Aubameyang has enjoyed a superb start to the new season despite Arsenal’s mixed form, scoring eight goals in 12 games.

After Xhaka’s shocking outburst on Sunday, Arsenal legend Charlie Nicholas says the Swiss has no future at the Emirates.

‘He has to take his medicine but I’ll be surprised if he comes back in any capacity to play for Arsenal again,’ he said.

Arsenal face Premier League leaders Liverpool in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup on Wednesday night.
